idea-plugin.name: Git Branch Border
idea-plugin.description:
Displays a colored border around the IDE window based on the current Git branch.

Features:
  • Visual indication of current branch via colored window border
  • Configurable colors per branch
  • Supports exact match, prefix match, and regex patterns
  • Optional blinking border for critical branches
  • Hot-reload - changes to config are applied immediately
  • No border when config file is missing (non-intrusive)
Configuration:
Create .branch-colors.json in your project root: 
{
  "borderWidth": 4,
  "defaultColor": "#FF6600",
  "blinking": { "enabled": false, "interval": 500 },
  "branches": [
    { "pattern": "master", "match": "exact", "color": "#FF0000" },
    { "pattern": "production", "match": "exact", "color": "#FF0000",
      "blinking": { "enabled": true, "interval": 300 } },
    { "pattern": "feature/", "match": "prefix", "color": "#9933FF" }
  ]
}
Match types: exact, prefix, regex
Blinking: Set enabled: true and interval in ms (100-5000)
